title: Requires custodial interrogations of children to be recorded through audiovisual means
summary: Requires custodial interrogations of children to be recorded through audiovisual means.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1757

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 11, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. LENTOL -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Judiciary

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  family  court act, in relation to the custodial
         interrogation of a child

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivisions 5, 6, 7, and 8 of section 305.2 of the family
    2  court act are renumbered subdivisions 6, 7, 8, and 9 and a new  subdivi-
    3  sion 5 is added to read as follows:
    4    5.  ANY CUSTODIAL INTERROGATION OF A CHILD AT A FACILITY DESIGNATED BY
    5  THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR OF THE COURTS AS A SUITABLE PLACE FOR THE  QUES-
    6  TIONING  OF  CHILDREN  SHALL  BE RECORDED AUDIOVISUALLY IN ITS ENTIRETY,
    7  INCLUDING ANY NOTIFICATION AND WAIVER OF RIGHTS REQUIRED BY  SUBDIVISION
    8  EIGHT  OF  THIS  SECTION OR THE CONSTITUTION OF THE UNITED STATES OR THE
    9  CONSTITUTION OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, AND IN A  MANNER  SUCH  THAT  THE
   10  PERSONS  DEPICTED  IN  THE  RECORDING  ARE  IDENTIFIABLE  AND THE SPEECH
   11  RECORDED IS INTELLIGIBLE. A STATEMENT BY A CHILD DURING  SUCH  CUSTODIAL
   12  INTERROGATION  MAY  BE  ADMITTED  IN  ANY  PROCEEDING AS DIRECT EVIDENCE
   13  AGAINST THE CHILD ONLY WHEN THE  AUDIOVISUAL  RECORDING  OF  THE  ENTIRE
   14  CUSTODIAL  INTERROGATION  DURING  WHICH  THE  STATEMENT  WAS  MADE, OR A
   15  COMPLETE COPY OF THAT RECORDING, HAS BEEN PROVIDED TO THE CHILD AND  HIS
   16  OR  HER PARENT OR GUARDIAN, IF PRESENT, UNLESS THE AUDIOVISUAL RECORDING
   17  AND ALL COPIES THEREOF ARE  UNAVAILABLE  DUE  TO  EXTRAORDINARY  CIRCUM-
   18  STANCES  BEYOND  THE  CONTROL  OF  THE  PRESENTMENT  AGENCY  AND THE LAW
   19  ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITIES WHO CONDUCTED THE CUSTODIAL INTERROGATION.
   20    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03782-01-1
